Yes, most museums in New York City offer interactive experiences for visitors. Here are a few recommendations:

1. The Museum of Modern Art (MoMA) has a digital art lab where you can create your own art, experiment with different techniques, and learn about new technologies in art.

2. The Whitney Museum of American Art has a collection of interactive installations and exhibits, including a sound and light installation that responds to your movements and a room full of flickering lights that creates an immersive experience.

3. The Metropolitan Museum of Art offers a variety of interactive experiences throughout the museum, including touchscreens and touchable objects that allow visitors to engage with the art in a hands-on way.

4. The Museum of Arts and Design has hands-on workshops and classes where visitors can learn new skills and create their own art.

5. The New Museum focuses on contemporary art and often has interactive installations and exhibits that encourage visitors to participate and engage with the art.

These are just a few examples of the interactive experiences available at museums in New York City. You might want to check the museum's website or ask at the information desk to see what options are available during your visit.
